title: "let" not working as expected from a json response
body:
I'm doing a POST and getting back the expected response with Content-Type application/json.  But when I follow that with a let it doesn't seem to be able to pull the desired value out of the response body.  I'm using the same syntax as I see in the "live documentation".

Here are the two relevant table rows (the POST and the let).

POST    /cart   201     Content-Type : application/json; charset=UTF-8
Date : Tue, 20 Mar 2012 19:27:11 GMT
Accept-Ranges : bytes
Location : http://sfftcpod:8111/cart/4f68da0fe4b0dd0376cc1df6
Server : Restlet-Framework/2.0.10
Vary : Accept-Charset, Accept-Encoding, Accept-Language, Accept
Transfer-Encoding : chunked     {"accountRef":"http://sfftcpod:8111/account/4f68da0fe4b0dd0376cc1df5","label":"default","websiteRef":"ws1","createDate":1332271631677,"priceRef":"http://sfftcpod:8111/cart/4f68da0fe4b0dd0376cc1df6/price","dispersionRef":"http://localhost:8111/disperser?dispersable=http://sfftcpod:8111/cart/4f68da0fe4b0dd0376cc1df6"}
let        dispRef  body    /dispersionRef/text()   null

You can see that the value I'm getting is "null", but I expect it to get the value:  http://localhost:8111/disperser?dispersable=http://sfftcpod:8111/cart/4f68da0fe4b0dd0376cc1df6

I tried the same thing following a GET of the same resource that I had just POSTed... this had the same result.

Can you see anything that I'm doing incorrectly?
